intro: Verbascum hajastanicum var. aragatzicum, commonly known as the Aragatsicum mullein, is a perennial plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable species in its native habitat.
